course_name: Natural Language Processing with Classification and Vector Spaces
instructor: Younes Bensouda Mourri, Łukasz Kaiser, Eddy Shyu
user_comments: ["I really enjoy and this course is exactly what I expect. Tutors explained many ideas clearly, especially Lin Ukkahn's lesson. I recommend everyone who is a beginner and has interest in NLP join this course.", "This course is excellent and is well-organized. Everything is presented clearly. I would highly recommend it!", "It is significantly oversimplified. The videos are very short (1-3 minutes) and provide almost no intuition. They merely show the source code without explaining it. The homeworks are just filling in variables on the code given by the instructions, so if you Google the names of functions from the hints in this course you will get the answer. The practice quizzes add nothing.", "The course is far too simplistic and superficial. Weeks consist of many 1-2 minute videos that give intuition but no details. The coding tasks are mostly copy-pasting incomplete code. It lacks clarity and depth.", "The concept is not clearly explained at all. The instructor seems to be just reading a script. He did not try to explain the math. Instead, he uses graphs to try to fool us. The other instructor hardly teaches anything but just to show his face and say a few opening sentences. I took Andrew Ng's courses and was impressed, but I am very disappointed by the quality of this course. Deeplearning.ai, please have some quality control over the courses you offer, otherwise it hurts your brand name!", "The course is rather disappointing. Videos are short. They give you an intuition why something works but don't go much into the details. When teacher said \"Now you are an expert in transformers\" it sounded like a mockery. The course material is split into four weeks, yet you can get a certificate in a few days. Homeworks won't teach you much. If you treat this course as introductory, you could take it, but don't expect too much.", "Superficial coverage of topics, lack of mathematical depth and sophistication. Dumbing down and simplification never help.", "All the videos in this course are very short and students only learn basic stuff. The homeworks are mostly implementing what was shown in the lectures, with little new code or thinking. There was a lack of detailed explanations.", "The course content is fairly simple and summarized. The hands-on activities are mostly following instructions. However, it is a decent overview for beginners.", "I'm a master's student who took an NLP course in university. The first 3 courses of this specialization are good, but this one was disappointing. The last 2 weeks are a complete sham. They claim to teach \"BERT\" and \"T5\" but don't really give any value. You're better off going elsewhere to learn these concepts."]

["The course content was well-structured and easy to follow, though some topics could have been explained in more depth.", "Good for beginners — covers the basics clearly but might feel a bit slow for advanced learners.", "The instructor explains concepts logically, but real-world examples would make it more engaging.", "I liked the step-by-step approach, though some sections felt slightly repetitive.", "Useful material overall, but I wish there were more hands-on exercises or quizzes.", "The pacing was comfortable, and the instructor’s communication was clear and concise.", "Great introduction to the topic — provides a solid foundation for further learning.", "Decent course with good coverage of fundamentals, though the visuals could be improved.", "It’s a good learning experience, especially if you’re new to this subject area.", "Informative and well-organized, but certain advanced topics were only briefly touched upon."]

course_name: Natural Language Processing with Attention Models
instructor: Younes Bensouda Mourri, Łukasz Kaiser, Eddy Shyu
user_comments: ["Can the instructors make maybe a video explaining the ungraded lab? That will be useful. Other students find it difficult to understand both LSH attention layer ungraded lab. Thanks", "Not up to expectations. Needs more explanation on some topics. Some were difficult to understand, examples might have helped!!", "The concept is not clearly explained at all. The instructor seems to be just reading a script. He did not try to explain the math. Instead, he uses graphs to try to fool us. The other instructor hardly teaches anything but just to show his face and say a few opening sentences. I took Andrew Ng's courses and was impressed, but I am very disappointed by the quality of this course. Deeplearning.ai, please have some quality control over the courses you offer, otherwise it hurts your brand name!", "The course is rather disappointing. Videos are short. They give you an intuition, why something works but don't go much into the details. When teacher said \"Now you are an expert in transformers\" it sounds like a mockery. The course material is split into four weeks, however you can obtain certificate after spending a few days. Homeworks won't teach you much. For you to understand, by now the hardest exercise according to course's Slack is to write a function with model and input tokens as input, which should predict next token. It's body contains only 8 lines of code, some of them is already given, your task is well explained.", "Superficial coverage of topics, lack of mathematical depth and sophistication. Dumbing down and simplification never help.", "I feel like I could have learned more by reading on StackOverflow - I didn't learn much here. Quality training materials could have been better.", "To anyone looking to learn the content for the first time, I would suggest reading the original papers. The videos oversimplify concepts or get them wrong, while the homework is the real content.", "Very disappointed by this course. I took the specialization to better understand Attention and these few videos are very unclear. I saw in the forum that my sentiment is shared by many people. Hope that Andrew will react and give us better learning material.", "I'm a master student who took an NLP course in university. The first 3 courses are good, but the 4th one is completely disappointing. First 2 weeks are confusing, last 2 weeks are a sham.", "This course has a good introduction to attention models, but the practical value is low. The videos are short, and many details (like data preparation, model tuning) are skipped. The labs reinforce the ideas, but an independent text or video resource might be needed to fully grasp the concepts."]

course_name: Natural Language Processing with Sequence Models
instructor: Younes Bensouda Mourri, Łukasz Kaiser, Eddy Shyu
user_comments: ["This is the third course of NLP Specialization. This was a great course and the instructors were amazing. I really learned and understood everything they taught, like LSTM, GRU, Siamese Networks, etc.", "Overall it was a great course. A little bit weak in theory, but for practical purposes whatever was sufficient. The detection of question duplication was a very cool model. I enjoyed it a lot.", "Well, very weak and oversimplified course. All videos are extremely short (1-4 minutes) and do not give any intuition or understanding of the sequence models. GRUs and LSTMs are explained too briefly. The last two assignments can be completed even without watching the lecture videos. To sum up, this course is a short intro to recurrent networks, but do not expect to deepen your knowledge. Totally disappointed.", "You can't learn anything with 3 minute videos, especially if 1 minute is wasted on repeating the previous video and an intro, and the last minute on a summary. It works for 15-minute lectures, but here it's too short. Also it's strange to list an instructor who only appears for 10 seconds to say 'today I will teach you', while all actual teaching is done by the assistant.", "Very bad class, a week's material can be done in around 2 hours. Exercises are uninteresting and repetitive. The course is basically just familiarizing with the Trax API and blindly applying neural network architectures with it. The videos are poor and repetitive, and they repeat themselves a lot. Instead of doing this course, it is better to do the original Sequence Models course from deeplearning.ai.", "Programming assignments not well constructed; need to restart notebooks to get the same exact output as expected. Not all expected outputs are printed out or have test functions similar to course 1. Some concepts in lecture are too quickly glossed over.", "I think the assignments should have gone deeper. We should have built an LSTM from scratch instead of just using Trax. I can always learn an API, but it would be nice to learn the nitty gritty of the model. I also would prefer longer lecture videos that go into more detail.", "I have previously completed other courses from deeplearning.ai and here are some thoughts: (1) I like learning about the Trax framework from the Python tutorials. (2) This course improved my understanding of models like Siamese networks. (3) The slides are too fancy and it feels like reading a script, not really teaching. But I learned a lot and hope the next course will be better.", "Programming notebooks contain a lot of errors and poor writing. The use of Trax instead of TensorFlow or PyTorch reduces usefulness of this course for picking up experience with frameworks I am likely to use.", "This course is very mechanical, expected more reasoning. It just walked through the topics quickly and extensively. I had to spend hours to build in-depth knowledge via external tutorials. I expected more explanation of what and why, rather than just showing how to use a library."]

course_name: Natural Language Processing with Probabilistic Models
instructor: Younes Bensouda Mourri, Łukasz Kaiser, Eddy Shyu
user_comments: ["Very good course! It helped me clearly learn about autocorrect, edit distance, Markov chains, n-grams, perplexity, backoff, interpolation, word embeddings, CBOW. This was very helpful!", "I'm really thankful to the professors for sharing their knowledge and experience and creating this excellent course. I have learned a lot. Thank you!!!", "It is the worst course on deeplearning.ai ever. It is too simple for those who already took the DL specialization and too difficult for new ones. The lectures are too superficial and you will barely understand a thing. The tasks are huge with a lot of spaghetti code and very superficial theory. You'll spend time implementing things without learning how they work. Nobody will teach you to use standard tools on simple examples.", "Viterbi algorithm could be explained better and Week 4 seemed very rushed with lots of details glossed over. The assignment in week 4 seems pretty easy compared to previous weeks.", "The lessons are shallow, and exercises are too repetitive.", "Lots of quality control issues. Using paying customers as proofreaders is tacky.", "This course is more mature than the first one. Materials are interesting and provide nice intuition for probabilistic models. Basics of autocorrection, HMMs, N-grams, Word2Vec are covered well. I enjoyed it. Some suggestions: lectures could be longer to add depth in math and code; assignments are unbalanced (HMMs assignment is tough, last one is easy); add more theory lectures. I recommend this course to everyone interested in NLP, but use additional resources to reinforce your knowledge.", "Although the content is great, the teaching method is lacking compared to how Andrew Ng teaches. More interactive teaching would help. The instructor's voice is a bit irritating over long durations. Otherwise the course provides a lot of learning if you can bear it.", "Very superficial course, just like the rest in the specialization. Quizzes and assignments are a joke. I didn't want to give negative feedback at first, but now that I'm doing course #4 (Attention) I see how bad these courses are. Very sad.", "A great course indeed! However, it would be even nicer to have the lecture videos in a slower pace, maybe go through the examples in more detail. Sometimes it felt too quick to jump directly from theory to examples."]

["Laurence Moroney is the best. Before taking the course, I didn’t know anything about AI or ML or TensorFlow. The concepts were explained in such a manner that anyone can learn TensorFlow.", "Excellent course! He’s just great! Fantastically deep knowledge, easy learning style, very practical presentation. Amazing and extremely useful course. Thank you!", "Compared to Andrew’s original ML course and the DeepLearning.AI specialization, this series of courses is very lightweight. The material is very good, well organized and clear, but it can be covered fairly quickly. The NLP course can be completed in an afternoon (all four weeks). Nothing wrong with the material, but I wish there was more of it.", "Very elementary introduction to NLP applications. As others have mentioned, the whole course can be done in a few hours. The lectures consist of short videos introducing code snippets but without depth. The quizzes test irrelevant details. The exercise notebooks are okay but redundant. After great expectations, I must say the first three courses of this specialization have been extremely disappointing.", "Missing a lot of things. This entire course could have been made in a single 5-minute video per week.", "One star for the ML poetry and one star for the content. The content can be learned in a few hours. It’s just a simplistic tutorial. Dilutes the value of Coursera specializations.", "Not challenging, very much beginner level course. Shouldn’t be tagged as intermediate in my opinion.", "The course is extremely basic and all the material can easily be covered in an article. Doesn’t build any transferrable skill.", "Very lightweight course – not more than an hour of real content. Extremely disappointed by this.", "Too basic. It could have been done in a simple blog post."]

["Outstanding mix of theory and practical applications to help understand the theory. Well organized and excellent presentations. Thank you!", "The workflow is clear and the professor speaks to the students directly about all aspects without skimming the material.", "Annoyingly, the specific prerequisites can’t be determined until AFTER enrolling. This course is in C++, so if you’re not a C++ programmer, it’s probably not a good idea to take this.", "This course needs updating. Some quizzes cover work not yet taught, and the programming assignment didn’t work with the latest toolkit. For a course of this caliber I expected more attention to detail. The course materials are not actively maintained on the forums.", "The course focuses on theory with no practical examples. It also doesn’t explain theoretical concepts in detail. It was difficult for me as a new learner to follow such dense concepts.", "This course is pretty good for full-time grads doing NLP research, but not for part-timers who want concrete skills. The course style is heuristic-based; some answers are missing. Textbooks are needed. It’s hard to cover NLP in 6 weeks, but it could be designed better.", "I think the course has very limited practical problems; for beginners it’s hard to grasp all the theoretical concepts presented.", "I didn’t feel like continuing. I had a problem at work that I enrolled to solve text mining efficiently, but it’s all theoretical and too much information in a short time with no examples.", "The content layout is very good. It gives a big picture about text mining. It’s hard to explain it in 6 weeks, but the professor did it. I hope there will be a follow-up class with more detailed cases and newer topics like knowledge graphs.", "The content is quite good. Professor Cheng explains the concepts well and I learned quite a bit. Overall it is a good resource."]

["Quite challenging but also quite a sense of accomplishment when you finish the course. I learned a lot and think this was the course I preferred in the specialization. I highly recommend it!", "Excellent course! Video lectures are high quality, with realistic problems and applications. Exercises are challenging and fun. Strongly recommend this course.", "It is no exaggeration to say it took me longer to complete this course than the first 3 courses in the specialization, and the time was utterly wasted. Mostly battling a poorly constructed course, with terrible assignments, a broken autograder and a professor who is disinterested in the education of his students.", "Very painful to go through this course. It seems to lack systematic structure. It just walks through topics quickly and extensively. I had to spend hours learning from external resources. I hope the course can simplify complicated topics to make life easier.", "I would see the autograder and unspecified instructions ruin this course. Sometimes you know how to get the answer and it looks right, but you still cannot pass because the autograder is broken. I would not take this course if it wasn’t part of the specialization.", "Instructor does not explain concepts, just superficially goes through subjects. Some lectures lack coherence between topics. But it introduces some basics worth knowing.", "Instructor was poor. Inadequate coverage of material, some questions unclear. It was better to read a book on this subject on your own.", "This is almost a waste of time. The structure can be clearer and the connection to Python is outdated. The assignments are poorly designed.", "I really wanted to like this course, but overall I'm unable to recommend it. The lectures were poorly explained and the autograder issues are too great."]

course_name: Gen AI Foundational Models for NLP & Language Understanding
user_comments: ["I have enjoyed this course. I can't wait to apply the skills I have learned in this class. Thank you to the fantastic team.", "Super course. Labs are very good to learn and are challenging too.", "The lab code is buggy. You face issues with almost every cell. Some core concepts this module relies on are outdated or deprecated. For example, TorchText was deprecated in 2023. What is the point of teaching it in 2024? Extremely disappointed with IBM.", "This is an extremely un-educational course and a hugely frustrating experience. It is fundamentally a voice reading through whatever is on a series of slide decks like a robot. There is no effort to make you understand anything, and no actual time to do it while listening. The only practical way to learn is to stop every 30 seconds, read and look up the material elsewhere, then resume. I am proficient in neural networks and GenAI but was completely incapable of following the explanations after the first 5 minutes: boring, robotic, ineffective. This was a very frustrating experience from a learner's perspective.", "I think the videos were bad for a number of reasons: too much explanation of basics we already know; explanations of what an RNN is was awful; the word2vec lab visualization didn't match the explanation; hardly any math explained at all. These topics are far too subtle to compress into 2-minute videos, and there should be references for further reading. This was by far the worst of the AI engineering stream.", "Uselessly filled with complex mathematical notation and not focused on explaining concepts in an easy way. First few courses of the certificate were amazing, but the next few by this instructor are abysmal.", "Badly curated; videos don't explain much. The Jupyter code snippets are interesting, but the knowledge isn't transmitted well.", "3 stars because of the videos and materials; if it was only labs it would be 4. Video materials could be much more than slides with AI-generated speech. Even with prior theoretical knowledge, videos were confusing. It felt like explanations were missing glue between the slides and subtopics."]

course_name: Python for Data Science, AI & Development
user_comments: ["This was an extremely informative course and I believe is perfect way to start off your coding journey. The teaching style was understandable.detail oriented and very practical. Highly Recommended.", "It is a good course if you have previous knowledge in python, in my case I did not have too much expertise in Programming and it was very difficult the las 2 weeks (4 and 5). However i learned a lot.", "All the basics for Data Science with Python. You wont be a master programmer after this class but you will understand the basics and computer logic in regards to data handling and cloud management.", "Course focuses more on forcing you to sign up for various IBM cloud tools than learning python. The final assignment has a 300+ reply thread in the discussion forum because you are graded on the ability to integrate your IBM Watson Notebook with IBM cloud storage, but the instructions have multiple errors... This class is a shameless excuse for making you sign up for products you don't want, and then grading you on your ability to use them, not your ability to write python code.", "In addition, I would like to see how should have been done the final assignment... I haven't learned anything... My money is going to waste. IBM says that you don't need previous knowledge of python or programming... that is a lie... The problem is this rubbish course.", "The worst course I took. I couldn't believe the course is provided by IBM! ... I'm probably never going to pay money for a coursera course again... not really worth it.", "I had a lot of problems with the Peer Assignment, which had nothing to do with Python Programming. ... I should not recommend this Specialization, because of the difficulties with the Watson environment. I am willing to help solving the problems.", "Every course has offered something interesting, challenging, and surprising. I am glad I have spent the time with this class. I would strongly recommend it to others with an interest in data science.", "As in the other parts of the certificate, the tasks are simply too easy. ... Actually, 2 stars are in my opinion unfair, since the creators have put a lot of time and love in the course content. Unfortunately, so much potential is thrown away.", "The course content is good. However, the instructions for the final peer graded assignment are unclear... Although I completed, I would not recommend to others until changes are made."]

["I really enjoyed this course. It was well paced and covered the basics nicely. The practice exercises were hard, but made sure you learned all the key concepts.", "The course was really good. The assignments were challenging. It was very pleasure to solve the assignments and practice them to become perfect with the basics of Python language.", "Final assignment on creating own bank is interesting and practical. Wish that the assignment explained things better though I managed to figure things out after struggling with it a little bit.", "The course has good slides, good explanation of syntax and plenty of exercises to practice. The actual and biggest problem is that the examples are not as complex as the assessments. The 4th assessment was a real disaster, too hard and you must expend much more time than suggested for such a beginner course.", "I was thinking of giving it 2 stars at least, as this course does cover a wide variety of topics. However, there are so many mistakes here. If you already know basic python, this course is a great way of getting introduced to new and advanced concepts. All in all, I'm disappointed as the previous course was quite good.", "This was a very good course for people just starting out with Python. The instructor was well spoken and did a nice job explaining the topics. If you have never been exposed to any sort of programming language then this course may take you a little bit longer to get up to speed, but the resources provided should be enough to get you started.", "So easy to learn with the videos and tutorials! I have gone through 2 other coding classes and haven't been able to finish because I get stuck and this one has been 100x better in helping me learn :)", "After trying tutorial after tutorial and exploring many resources (Codecademy, Udemy, etc) and not succeeding, I finally found one that works! This is a very fun course, and the free textbook is simply incredible."]

["This course is designed for absolute beginners who want to start their journey in python. The contents of the course is really amazing. One will fall in love with python after completing this course.", "I really loved the course. Tutor is great, she is very good at teaching. I was a beginner in Python programming, now I am familiar with more python. Thank you Coursera for providing me financial aid.", "I loved the Google IT Support Certificate program and was so looking forward to loving this first course in a new Google Certificate program, Python for Automation. Sadly, I cannot recommend this course to anyone, really. Especially not beginners... I can honestly say this was one of the most unpleasant courses I've ever taken - and that's saying something.", "the coding videos are relatively short and concise while the questions are extremely hard and does not match to the actual content. not really a beginner friendly", "I can't give this course higher than 1 star until they fix the bugs in the quizzes.", "As I had some previous Python experience, I completed this course in about a week. There is nothing here that you cannot get from free tutorials on YouTube. The auto-graders for the assignments are buggy and some of the concepts in the quizzes are not taught in the lecture videos. If you want to learn the basics of Python, you can do so for free on your own and do not need to pay for this course.", "This course was really helpful in developing my coding skills in python. The exercises helped me to test my knowledge. Overall it was really good for people like me who are just beginning with python.", "So far not impressed, just makes you frustrated and not want to learn programming.", "Despite actually having some decent foundations in Python and programming, I did not enjoy the course. The instructor is super friendly and the videos are fun enough, but the assignments got more annoying with every subsequent quiz... The worst part is that the videos do not prepare you for the assignments mentioned above."]

course_name: Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
user_comments: ["Dr Chuck is amazing!! Great methods, and informative.. Gained knowledge and confidence. Definitely worth the time.. cant wait to start my next course with the University of Michigan, and with Dr Chuck", "It's a great course to learn the basics of python. The course is entertaining. The Instructor is also very friendly and he teaches Python with very good techniques and with excitement.", "Excellent, although, even without having any programming experience and very little math I managed to make it through this course. But in my opinion the course could have been more difficult and the pace quicker.", "Extremely basic but Dr. Chuck is so interesting that you never get bored. He makes a difficult subject easy to learn. It's a good starting point for beginners.", "Great introduction to Python and programming as a whole. Had zero programming experience before and this class made it easy and fun to get into.", "I did not find this course helpful. The assignments seem to ask for more info that you've been taught... It's like making a newborn baby watch a video on swimming and then throwing it into the ocean... I would not recommend this course for beginners.", "Great introduction to Python and programming as a whole. It was very easy to understand. Had zero programming experience before, this course made it easy and fun to get into.", "After trying tutorial after tutorial and exploring many resources (Codecademy, Udemy, etc) and not succeeding, I finally found one that works! This is a very fun course, and the free textbook is simply incredible.", "The professor's lectures are so awesome, however, content is adjusted to new programming learners. If you need more practice, the next part of this course, Python Data Structures, is charged.", "If I were taking as part of the Developer certificate I'd have given it higher, but coming from the Database Eng one it's a mess. It's not exactly a beginner-friendly course. But for those getting the certificate, this course is a necessary evil to obtain the certificate."]

["perfect for beginner level. all the concepts with code and parameter wise have been explained excellently. overall best course in making anyone eager to learn", "I started this course without any knowledge on Data Analysis with Python, and by the end I was able to understand the basics and usage of libraries (NumPy, Pandas).", "Very low quality of the course. Structure is illogical... labs contain all the code so a pupil doesn't have to do his/her best... It's not what I expected... I lost all my motivation.", "So many mistakes in videos and labs, including spelling errors. Eg. the video that said '150 - 50 = 50'. These errors have not been addressed.", "Many typos and other errors. My favorite was the video where they said '150 - 50 = 50'.", "Honestly, I'm not sure why this course has such a high rating... the final peer-graded assignment was a complete mess. The course is supposed to be intended for beginners, however it was a complete disaster, NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL!", "I am working through the IBM Data Science Certificate courses and this is easily the best one I have taken so far. The labs provide a variety of hands-on exercises and real Python coding.", "Too many new functions with no option to practice. Each week, in the end it's a total mess in the head. This course should contain real exercises, lots of them.", "AN excellent course. Hands-on training on the cloud makes an individual really involved. So far the best online course I have ever taken, and I have learned Python programming a lot from this course.", "Low quality. Do not recommend this course at all. Boring teaching method. Full of errors. No IT support for problems."]

["Great Course. It included information about all aspects of Python from Basic syntax to Exception & File handling, OOPS concepts & even covered Python Software testing. It was worth of time.", "This course is good well detailed and elaborate, the labs are challenging but worth the hard work. I recommend it for anyone who needs to learn python programming.", "i was thinking of giving it 2 stars at least, as this course does cover a wide variety of topics. However, there are so many mistakes here. If you already know basic python, this is a great way of getting introduced to new and advanced concepts. All in all, I'm disappointed as the previous course was quite good.", "The assignments in this course were not well matched to the content. Many of the coding assignments required knowledge of commands that were not taught until later in the course...", "this course is great for covering many aspects of python, but it requires more study from other resources as well... overall it was great experience.", "The very basics of Python and programming are covered in this course, but it lacks any in-depth explanation... I had to buy a Python book, and there is no support in forums. It's a good roadmap for self-taught programmers but it won't fully prepare you.", "very badly explained, NOT for beginners", "It was a great Python course. The instructor and all the samples have been very up to the mark. All the sample codes and assignments are very helpful and in line with the content. I would say this course is a prerequisite for advanced python courses. Thank you Instructors.", "This is a wonderful course, made with soul. This is a wonderful story in simple words about complex topics. I cannot thank you enough."]

["A great course, explaining what matters, nice examples. I would have loved to get some more advanced examples and how to choose a data structure that is best suited to the data.", "I really enjoyed this course. There was a wide range of things covered and even though I had no experience with Python at the start I now feel confident enough to do the basics.", "Google needs to change the course from 'Getting Started in Python' or lower the steep difficulty level... lectures emphasize basics, but questions of same lectures are much higher difficulty and doesn't explain... strategy leaves students frustrated & disappointed.", "Great course for a beginner, but the labs are so difficult, you cannot finish them based on those videos and readings without any previous knowledge about Python.", "The materials and presentations are excellent, but I am not a fan of the busy work involved in the end of course PACE portfolio work. My suggestions: remove this excess material and \"re-factor\" the PACE/portfolio material and provide the expected mark sheets clearly.", "This course covers the essentials for data analytics well, introduction to Python basics and pandas. Good amount of lab practice to reinforce topics. However, this course is not sufficient if you have little to no experience in Python. I would highly recommend a full basic course on Python for data science first, before proceeding.", "This was a very good course for people just starting out with Python. The instructor was well spoken and did a nice job explaining the topics... If you have never been exposed to any sort of computer programming language then this course may take you a little bit longer to get up to speed, but the resources provided should be enough to get you started.", "Exceptionally well-designed course! I just loved it. I knew Python before but from this course, I learned the ways to communicate results. Lastly, The instructor was amazing.", "Overall the course is pretty good. The Python tutorials could be more interactive, include more tutorials and then gradually increasing the difficulty level."]

["This is best introductory programming course in python. Mentors are planting every concept in our head in very fluent ways. You must take this course as a beginner python programmer like me.", "This course is very good for beginners. The content and flow of the course is amazing. The online practice tool to run our codes online without installing any software makes it even more user friendly.", "I have no reason to rate it a star less than 5! The practice exercises and modes of teaching were on point. Also enjoyed the jokes at the end of each section (lol).", "This course offers excellent external tools for learning, like the Interactive Textbook and that makes it much more fun and relaxing to learn. Also Mr. Resnick adds his charisma which you cannot forget.", "It's a must join course for the people who want to deep dive into the world of Python. I really loving this course very much. I wanna explore more hence opting for other parts of this specialization.", "I took this course after completing four of the five courses from ‘Python for Everybody’ specialization offered by University of Michigan. Python for Everybody Specialization is a kind of overview of Python. But this course (Python Basics) is an in-depth course that gives great insight into the Python language. I would say that this course has taught me many new and basic things.", "Far too slow for experienced programmers who want to learn Python. This course is actually teaching Python as a first programming language."]

course_name: Databases and SQL for Data Science with Python
user_comments: ["Amazing course for beginners! The entire course is well structured and has good hands-on assignments. SQL is extremely essential for Database management and fun learning so please do try this one out!", "Great course easy to follow, very good notes, videos and guidance on how to complete the assignments. This is a great introduction course to begin your knowledge and training to be a Data Scientist.", "Much important instruction was missing which led to a delay in submission of the peer assignment. Various errors popped up which had no solution in the discussion forum also. Kindly look into it.", "It was a wonderful and joyful learning from the starting to end, I also enjoyed solving the queries on the hands on. I strongly suggest this course for any beginner who wants to learn SQL.", "This course was an Excellent, Interesting, and knowledgeful game for me. I have been excited to learn SQL and Databases and finally IBM and Coursera let my dream come true. Thanks to both of them!", "If you are located outside USA or Canada, don't take this course. Because IBM cloud DB2 will not give you free account to do the lab exercises. Otherwise you have to pay $202 to get an account. I didn't continue the course due to this issue.", "This course is more about IBM roping you into using a bloated cloud ecosystem, than it is about teaching you SQL. You will only learn DB2 stuff, and only through their cloud dashboard. This entire specialization is disappointing, but if you've made it this far, masochism may carry you through it.", "The course teaches SQL quite well. But it doesn't teach and make practice about the connection to a database and use of sql magic. Hence, its very frustrating to understand the significance of '%sql' in a Final Assignment. The final assignment felt like it was to check whether we can connect to the database, rather than checking our subject knowledge on SQL."]

course_name: AI Agents in Java with Generative AI Specialization
Java Programming: Solving Problems with Software
instructor: Owen Astrachan, Robert Duvall, Andrew D. Hilton, Susan H. Rodger
user_comments: ["Excellent introduction to Java. A little heads up if you're taking the course: Answers need to be truncated to x decimal places in quizzes, not rounded. (Instructors please clarify this in all quizzes!)", "Excellent explanations and amount of course work for practice, the tests made good use of the examples and work given, I am satisfied with what I learned in this course and see it's real world usage.", "To say this course is for beginners is a misnomer. It feels like a college-level CS course. I came into this course with zero formal programming knowledge and was completely overwhelmed by the pace and material. It does not give students enough \"small wins\" to build muscle memory and gain confidence. I folded almost at the end of week 2. The instructors assume too much about what their students know. Really kicking myself for spending the money trying to limp through this course.", "I have just started the course, but it is way over my head. This should clearly be marked as intermediate, advanced or for people already in IT industry.", "Very disappointing for me. I chose the course to learn the fundamentals of Java, but it is really everything but motivating. The lessons are short and kept very easy and informative, but for the assignments you have to do things that were never mentioned anywhere, so you spend hours of research online on how to do the assignments. That's not why I wanted to visit a course, hours of frustrating online research I can also have while learning it on my own.", "There are other OOP courses out there that are easier to follow & execute on assignments. The java editor used in this class is clunky and ridiculous and the assignment instructions seem out of date and disorganized - this class was infuriating. It takes simple assignments and obfuscates instructions.", "Really poor course structure and material explanations. Canceling subscription.", "Literally one of the worst courses I've ever seen in twenty years of studying. No evaluation (correction check) for assignments, no reading material is provided by the instructors (except for the two million free websites they refer to which makes this course pointless.). I regret I paid one month for this course.", "I signed up for this course because I really liked the first one regarding HTML, CSS and JS. This one, however, is the opposite. The gap of difficulty between this course and the previous one is abysmal. I ended up being able to finish the course but only because I have a friend who's a programmer who helped almost every step of the way. The teachers are still good and the forums help, but the difficulty and the fact that at times the course feels out of order makes me recommend only doing this course if you have an intermediate level. If you're a beginner, do their first course on HTML, CSS, JS and find another course to learn Java.", "This is an Awesome Course. The best thing about this course is that it has weekly quizzes and assignments as well as Practice Quizzes for particular topics which helps in learning it more easily."]

course_name: Intermediate Java Development: Spring, Databases, Deployment Specialization

user_comments: ["Best course for Java. Covering both fundamentals and advanced concepts with hands-on practice in lab assignments.", "Very recommended this course if are beginner in java, it gives you an approach to perform jobs in a real environment.", "Nice Course, explained clearly with Hands on Lab for practical experience!", "The assignments are tedious for no reason, the automated grading system is very badly optimized, made me spend too much time looking after capitalization and spacing in print commands even though the code was running perfectly fine as intended, there are many mistakes in the assignments and too many vague commands.", "I see multiple improvement areas such as : The content is fast paced. And the Graded Assignments lacks proper guidelines. There is no proper support. Sometimes it felt frustrating as I was unable to complete some of the assignments. Many of the videos doesn't have subtitles. Missing resource link / image even though the instructor explicitly mentioned about it.", "There are several issues with this course. Within Module 1 alone, there are inconsistent quiz responses. For instance, there were two questions with answers that contradicted each other. Additionally, when submitting the final lab there were compile time errors for not having overloaded constructors in subclasses to match the parent class. The instructions for such a graded assignment should be clearly communicated.", "Though course, but good", "good", "This is a deeply insightful course, unlike many other tutorials or courses on Java. Important concepts were thoroughly covered, such as serialization and exception handling. While these are not \"fun\" topics, it's what makes a good developer different from others. Minus 1 star is because the quizzes are designed overly complex and didn't serve a good purpose. Please improve it.", "Good material."]

instructor: IBM Skills Network Team, Ramanujam Srinivasan

["The professor who teaches the course explains the concept very effectively. course_name: C++ For C Programmers, Part A
user_comments: ["It is an awesome course to move to c++ from C. Includes all the essential elements needed in C programming. i.e the best course available to learn C++.", "I really loved this course. It is really helpful for my programming aspect. I have managed to develop my logical abilty and this course really helped me.", "Great teaching of topics covered. Covered far more than expected upon enrollment (and took way more time than expected). Lectures were slowly paced and tended to meander.", "I really enjoyed the course. I like the instructor's way of explaining things and definitely learned a lot. A big thanks to you, Mr. Pohl. Keep up the great work.", "A very good course, especially for people like me that have a lot experience in coding c program but want to learn something more to advance my career. I'll recommend this course to my friend.", "This is a terrible course. The questions are often trivial, and many require the use of pseudocode that is not defined or explained anywhere. All major features of C++ are skipped. Very unhelpful class.", "The lecture was good, the reviews of my work were pointless-- most of the reviews appeared to be done randomly or incorrectly. Taking a busy class and having to babysit submissions would have really helped the next student improve.", "I still don't believe that I am lucky enough to get the opportunity to learn so much about such a great language from one of the most knowledgeable professors i.e Ira Pohl. I have gotten so good with understanding the most complex of the constructs in c++ now and have built up an affinity for the language and one of its most disliked and almost not much known by most of the c++ users i.e graphs. I have become 6 star problem solver on competitive programming platforms and have gained a lot of confidence and knowledge of its new features. Would be Forever grateful to Coursera for this wonderful experience! Thank You!", "It's wonderful platform to learn. highly recommended for those people who are interested to learn particular concept of c++ program.", "this course gives brief explanation of modern c++ and gives best intro about how to use this C++ into factory and real world"]

course_name: C++ For C Programmers, Part B
user_comments: ["It was good to avoid redundantly learning what C language is. Graph theory and Monte-Carlo methodology were fun. I enjoyed listening history of computer science and programming languages.", "From History to Today's Programming World, every session lookout from Great perspective & passes through students that's really appreciate.", "This course is garbage. It doesn't cover or test ANY important feature of C++! No derived classes, no namespaces, no discussion of the STL or special member functions, just for a start. There is no possible way that passing the practice final exam can be considered a meaningful for understanding C++.", "The lecture was good, the reviews of my work were pointless and often incorrect... ["Very good course that teaches you the most important aspects in programming in one of the World's first coding languages.", "Wonderful! ["Very well explained and the steps are easy to understand and follow along. course_name: Supervised Machine Learning: Regression and Classification
instructor: Andrew Ng, Aarti Bagul, Geoff Ladwig, Eddy Shyu
user_comments: ["After finishing the course, I realized that all practice materials were removed. As a paying member, we should still have access to the practice materials even after completion.", "This course is very clean, crisp and better than any classroom program. Kudos to the team who put this together.", "It uses high school math and calculus so the mathematics part is manageable. However, the course doesn't go into the inner workings of some scikit‑learn libraries.", "Most assignments are extremely basic and don't dive deep. Despite that, the course is still valuable for beginners to get started.", "A great beginner‑friendly course — the instructors explain everything clearly and the labs complement the lectures perfectly.", "The quizzes and code exercises are way too simple. Vectorization isn't fully explained, which left me confused.", "This course, taught by Andrew Ng, is one of the best I've ever taken. Thanks to the team for making such a quality course.", "I liked the optional lab but found it took far longer than the estimated time; still, it's worth doing.", "As someone with no background, I found the course accessible and the examples easy to follow."]

["This course changed the way I think about deploying ML models in production; it's full of insights for real-life projects.", "It is excellent and well explained for data scientists, software engineers and managers.", "The course is very basic and lacks hands‑on content; I expected more depth.", "Too theoretical, I wanted more practical production examples.", "It promises production ML but that part is absent — it's just another ML course.", "I found the real‑life insights and case studies extremely helpful; the course can be completed quickly.", "Shifting from a code‑centric to a data‑centric view of ML was eye‑opening.", "After completing this course, I'm excited to take the next courses; Andrew Ng's insights are golden.", "Good for refreshing your knowledge, but you need prior understanding of models to get the most out of it."]

instructor: Andrew Ng, Eddy Shyu, Aarti Bagul, Geoff Ladwig
user_comments: ["The course is well structured and easy to follow; it removes the enigma around machine learning.", "It's pitched at the right level, walking you through concepts of unsupervised learning, recommendation systems and reinforcement learning.", "Unit tests in the programming assignments were too strict and hindered exploring alternate solutions.", "The assignments lack challenging problems; they mostly guide you step by step.", "Programming exercises could be improved with more programming assignments; I wanted deeper hands-on practice.", "The reinforcement learning section was confusing; the instructions were unclear.", "Overall, a great course with an excellent syllabus and up‑to‑date examples, thanks to Andrew Ng and team.", "It's beginner friendly but also covers the mathematical underpinnings enough to be interesting.", "Completing the entire specialization gave me confidence to move deeper into ML; this course is a strong finish."]

["This course provides an interesting introduction to AI and helps you see how to integrate AI into your own tasks.", "It offers the right level of information and pace — not too technical but still substantive.", "A comprehensive overview for novices who need an understanding of AI's potential and limitations.", "The course is motivating and encourages us to adopt AI in our work.", "Andrew Ng presents complex ideas clearly and with relevant examples; he demystifies AI.", "It's quite elementary; some feel it should be cheaper because of its basic content.", "The course is very basic but a good starting point for those completely new to AI.", "The simplicity of the presentation makes it accessible to non‑technical learners; still, engineers may find it too easy.", "A clear and non‑technical introduction to AI that encourages ethical considerations."]

instructor: Andrew Ng, Kian Katanforoosh, Younes Bensouda Mourri
user_comments: ["The assignments are too simple and mostly pre‑written; you just fill in blanks and run the code.", "There is no assignment in Python – it’s all pre‑coded, making it unhelpful for people who want to practise on their own.", "Assignments don’t teach – most of the code is written for you; you only complete a few lines of code.", "The labs are not challenging because they provide 90 % of the code; you just copy and paste.", "Much of the course uses Octave, which is inconvenient for me; I wish everything were in Python.", "The course is well‑structured and helps with fundamental concepts – it’s a great start to deep learning.", "Assignments were easier than expected, but overall the course is great and covers the basics well.", "Andrew Ng explains things extremely well; this course is an excellent introduction to deep learning.", "The course is heavy on Octave and the assignments are time‑consuming; Python examples would make it better.", "Clear explanations and good overview; assignments are interesting but I wish there were more open coding."]

instructor: Andrew Ng, Kian Katanforoosh, Younes Bensouda Mourri
user_comments: ["The instructions for the YOLO assignment were misleading – the test dataset uses a different file name than the instructions.", "Great course; I’d recommend refreshing Python and TensorFlow before starting.", "The course is very well structured and easy to follow; assignments are good and fun.", "This course is challenging compared to previous courses, but it’s a good learning experience.", "Assignments require good knowledge of TensorFlow and Keras that isn’t provided, which is demotivating.", "The course is intensive and covers a lot; overall it’s wonderful and worth the effort.", "Good course but assignments have editing issues; some code formatting is off and confusing.", "Assignments are poorly commented and difficult to understand; they need improvement.", "They should provide at least a GPU training example – training locally takes too long.", "The assignments are poorly explained; sometimes you spend more time debugging than learning."]

instructor: Andrew Ng, Eddy Shyu, Kian Katanforoosh, Younes Bensouda Mourri
user_comments: ["Great course but sometimes editing mistakes and mislabelled variables hamper learning.", "There are editing errors like wrong variable names that make assignments confusing, and there isn’t enough explanation about Keras.", "Keras functions are treated like black boxes – the course should explain them instead of just using them.", "The course is good but not as polished as previous ones; there are typos and missing comments in the notebooks.", "It relies too much on Keras and doesn’t explain the code; assignments feel poorly prepared.", "The course is well structured and covers advanced topics like attention, but assignments have minor issues.", "Wonderful course, but reading the entire Jupyter notebook after the assignment is necessary to understand it fully.", "Random variable names inconsistent across lectures cause confusion and reduce clarity.", "The course content is not stable – there are missing code segments, but it’s still good to learn new stuff.", "Too many errors in tasks and unclear instructions reduce the fun; the course would be great if these were fixed."]

course_name: Introduction to TensorFlow for Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning
user_comments: ["This felt like a glorified TensorFlow/Keras tutorial – I expected more in‑depth treatment and practical tips.", "I was expecting more elaborate content and graded programming exercises; most content is based on free tutorials.", "Very unsatisfied – the course required too much trial and error and didn’t deliver on its promises.", "The course is expensive; tasks are simple and you can learn better for free on the internet.", "After finishing the course, I feel that most tasks were copy‑and‑paste; I regret paying for it.", "The course is way too easy – more like a step‑by‑step guide; not advanced at all.", "Good high‑level overview of TensorFlow; suitable for beginners but lacks depth.", "Great introduction for people new to AI; the assignments are helpful and well organised.", "Interesting course, but the final assignment instructions are unclear; still a nice introduction.", "Loved the course – the instructor explains things clearly and I learned a lot about classification tasks."]

course_name: Introduction to Deep Learning & Neural Networks with Keras
user_comments: ["The final assignment does not reflect the content of the lectures; there is no staff feedback and the course feels like self‑learning.", "The instructor is great but I expected a deeper intermediate‑level course – this one is too easy.", "Instructors do not answer questions; the assignments are poorly designed and confusing.", "Important concepts like dropouts, CNN and RNN are not covered; the course is not comprehensive.", "The title is wrong – it teaches only logistic regression and doesn’t live up to its name.", "Content is high quality, but some of the libraries used are outdated.", "The course doesn’t go deep into theory; assignments are not enough to practise; I expected more detail.", "The final assignment is poorly designed and doesn’t align with the rest of the course – I struggled to complete it.", "The lectures are nice but the final exam is confusing; some tasks are just repetitive steps.", "This course covers only the basics, but it’s a good start and well structured."]

instructor: Saeid Mehri, Joseph Santarcangelo, Alex Aklson (IBM)
user_comments: ["The reinforcement‑learning section is extremely light – no Q‑learning or deep RL; it’s just basic concepts.", "Too much time is spent on simple deep‑learning models; the reinforcement‑learning part is superficial.", "The course lacks hands‑on RL exercises; it’s more like reading slides than doing projects.", "There are many errors in the slides; examples in Jupyter notebooks do not work; the course needs an update.", "It’s basically just watching slides; not enough practice – the RL section feels tacked on.", "The JupyterLab is not working properly and there are no installation instructions; it’s frustrating.", "Good introduction to deep learning; the reinforcement‑learning part is too short – a separate course is needed.", "The course uses PyTorch for DL and RL; it’s great for introducing these topics and assignments are step‑by‑step.", "I enjoyed the course, but there were some issues with the tests and assignments; still a nice overview.", "The course is well structured and the lectures are helpful, but I expected more depth in reinforcement learning."]

instructor: Saeid Mehri, Joseph Santarcangelo, Alex Aklson (IBM)
user_comments: ["After finishing the Keras course, this PyTorch course feels bland – it’s mostly coding without explanation.", "The structure is poor and the assignments don’t teach; they just show code and ask to fill blanks.", "I didn’t receive my certificate; the labs are too simple and there is no deep learning theory.", "The exam instructions contradict the provided images; it’s confusing to follow.", "The course uses an AI voice with no passion and tasks are repetitive; more theory would help.", "Balanced difficulty and a good learning environment; I enjoyed the labs and assignments.", "The course is straightforward, but I wish there was more math and theory.", "The labs replicate the videos; you just do the same thing again – not very challenging.", "I liked the course; the progression from basics to advanced topics is nice and assignments are helpful.", "Good sequence of lectures, but the final exam is too long and not well explained."]

course_name: The Complete Cisco CCNA & CCNP Course 2025
user_comments: ["Ashish is a very good instructor. Once you get used to his accent it's an enjoyable experience. Personally, it wasn't hard to get used to. I like that he provides labs that can be created in virtual environments such as GNS3 and can be applied to live equipment if provided on your own. I'm thankful that the instructor took the time to create this course which is full of hands on examples that you can retake as many times as you need in order to drill the concepts home. He communicates often and has added labs along the way which is just icing on the cake. I highly recommend this instructor and his courses. 5 STARS!", "The course is very informative, right on the point, no unnecessary information and entirely a hands-on course. It is good for someone who would like to learn Cisco networking in action and be capable of DOING rather than just be able to pass Cisco exams! It might be still very useful for Cisco exams, but it might not cover all the details for that matter. I personally enjoyed this course a lot and I can apply all the knowledge I learned from it in my workplace on a daily basis. Regarding the language and accent, if the trainee has lived his entire life with one single accent around him in a small town, this course might be a bit challenging to follow, but if one is coming with an international mind-set, he can follow every single line of the course. The only negative comment could be that the course pace might be very fast for new learners and before each session, a bit of definitions, terminology and concepts could be helpful. the course starts with a list of tasks and then goes right away to terminal and commands. Good for me, but for new people in Cisco world, it might be a bit challenging to follow. Overall I recommend this course a lot and will buy more courses from Ashish :-)", "I'm impressed with how the teacher is explaining EIGRP in a simple and short way.", "Personally, no reservation i love the instructor . You make this course so simple and then you give students take to listen to each of your words. I appreciate and HIGHLY recommend other students to join", "The content is right to the point and simple to follow and Lab yourself. Many times we don't spend time testing our troubleshooting abilities. This course, and, the way it's taught allows me strengthen this critical skill.", "Practical knowledge of the subject matter with clear and concise instructions. Being able to simultaneously watch Ashish guide me while I do the labs myself help a ton! Plus, if I'm feeling confident enough to figure something out on my own, I can try in my own lab and then watch the video afterwards should I run into any obstacles.", "This is a great course which I haven't been able to find anywhere else. Well layed out and easy to understand and follow. IF you work in a large Database Environment I would definitely recommend", "Great Video so far. Clear Teacher and instructional videos. I'm really enjoying it. Plus it gets right to the point! Not all the fluff that's some of the other videos have.", "Exelente con GNS3 se entiende todo =) , espero que NEXUS lo haga lo mismo", "It has lot of Labs and every lap has v important Information."]
